result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L. Sanderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin L. Sanderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin L. Sanderson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONSECUTIVE to 14CM283.   Credit for 70 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge.   
May not have contact with Emily Galuszka, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: deft's adoptive mother wrote to Judge Wagner Malloy
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Victim present and addressed.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions consecutive to 14CM283; credit for 70 days served if revoked; deft to pay $200 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty DeFilippis withdraws suppression motion, reports that the case is resolved.  PLEAS set for 7/23/15 at 9:45am.  Bond continued.

Atty DeFillipis also has filed a suppression motion.  MH adjourned to 7/22/15 at 3pm.  Bond continued.
